Package halfpastnoon.sys

Class Crop

  • java.lang.Object
    • halfpastnoon.sys.Organism
      • halfpastnoon.sys.Crop
  • public abstract class Crop
extends Organism
    Represents all crops. The user will be able to plant, fertilize, water, and harvest crops, among other possible actions. Crops will be one of the primary sources of money for the player.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      boolean harvestable
      Whether the crop can be harvested.
      int harvestStage
      What stage the crop should stop growing at and be ready for harvest.
      int postHarvestStage
      What stage the crop should return to after being harvested if it is a reharvestable crop.
      boolean reharvestable
      Whether the crop can be harvested more than once.

      • Fields inherited from class halfpastnoon.sys.Organism

        dailyHyd, dailyNut, hydration, nutrition, species, stage

    • Field Detail

      • harvestable

        public boolean harvestable
        Whether the crop can be harvested.

      • reharvestable

        public final boolean reharvestable
        Whether the crop can be harvested more than once. If a crop is "reharvestable", then harvesting the crop will not kill it. For example, a tomato plant would be a reharvestable crop whereas a turnip plant would not.

      • postHarvestStage

        public final int postHarvestStage
        What stage the crop should return to after being harvested if it is a reharvestable crop. If reharvestable is false, then this value is not relevant.

      • harvestStage

        public final int harvestStage
        What stage the crop should stop growing at and be ready for harvest.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Crop

        public Crop​(java.lang.String sp,
            float dh,
            float dn,
            int hs,
            boolean rh,
            int phs)
        Initializes a new Crop with the specified attributes.
        Parameters:
        sp - the crop's species.
        dh - the crop's daily hydration requirement.
        dn - the crop's daily nutrition requirement.
        hs - the crop's "ready for harvest" stage.
        rh - whether the crop is reharvestable or not.
        phs - the stage the crop should return to.

      • Crop

        public Crop​(java.lang.String sp,
            float dh,
            float dn,
            int hs)
        Initializes a new Crop with the specified attributes. Assumes that the crop is not reharvestable.
        Parameters:
        sp - the crop's species.
        dh - the crop's daily hydration requirement.
        dn - the crop's daily nutrition requirement.
        hs - the crop's "ready for harvest" stage.

    • Method Detail

      • grow

        public void grow()
        Increments the crop's stage. If stage reaches the crop's harvestStage, then harvestable will be set to true. If harvestable is already true when this method is invoked, the crop's stage will not be incremented.

      • update

        public void update()
        Calls Organism.update(), and then calls grow() if the Crop is still alive.

        From Organism.update():
        Subtracts dailyNut from nutrition and dailyHyd from hydration. If either value falls below zero, then the organism will die.
        Overrides:
        update in class Organism

      • harvest

        public Product harvest()
        Harvests the crop. Upon successful execution of this method:
        • If reharvestable is true, then the stage will be set to postHarvestStage
        • A new Product will be returned whose Product.name matches species.
        Returns:
        a Product representing the harvested form of this crop.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - thrown if the method is invoked when harvestable is false.
